articles.author: Samy Magdy | AP
articles.title: Refugees shot dead in Tripoli forced out of UN facility
articles.description: Two Eritrean asylum-seekers were shot dead inside their accommodation in the Libyan capital Tripoli, days after the UN Refugee Agency pressed them to leave its facility citing overcrowdings
articles.content:
KHARTOUM, Sudan Two Eritrean asylum-seekers were shot dead in the Libyan capital, Tripoli, days after the U.N. refugee agency pressed them to leave its facility citing overcrowding.
The UNHCR confirmed the deaths in a statement Friday saying its deeply sadde… [+251 chars]

articles.author: Associated Press
articles.title: The Latest: Ukraine expects compensation, apology from Iran
articles.description: The head of the Ukrainian airline whose jetliner was shot down by an anti-aircraft missile in Iran says he was sure all along that that the company was not at fault. The airline company’s president said in a Facebook post Saturday that his team “did not for a…
articles.content:
We did not for a second doubt that our crew and our plane could not have been the cause of this terrible, awful air catastrophe, airline president Evgeniy Dikhne said on Facebook. They were our best guys and girls. The best.
___
12:15 p.m.
Ukraines preside… [+1589 chars]

articles.author: Subramoney Iyer | AP
articles.title: India demolishes buildings for violating environmental norms
articles.description: Authorities in southern Kerala state have razed down two high-rise luxury apartments using controlled implosion in one of the largest demolition drives in India
articles.content: The apartments were a pale shadow of their former luxurious appearance after demolition agencies for two months chipped away at the buildings, reducing them to a bare skeletal frame. The buildings came down crashing in seconds as a thick cloud of smoke spread… [+967 chars]

articles.author: Isabelle Khurshudyan, Erin Cunningham
articles.title: Zelensky calls for admission of guilt, justice after Iran admits to mistakenly shooting down Ukrainian plane
articles.description: "This morning was not good, but it brought the truth," the Ukrainian president said.
articles.content:
The passenger plane, a Boeing 737-800 en route to Kyiv, turned toward a sensitive military site belonging to Iran's Revolutionary Guard at an altitude that made it appear to be a hostile aircraft, Irans General Staff of the Armed Forces said in a statement.

articles.author: Aya Batrawy | AP
articles.title: Oman names culture minister as successor to Sultan Qaboos
articles.description: Oman announced Saturday that culture minister Haitham bin Tariq Al Said has been named as the new ruler of the country and the successor to Sultan Qaboos
articles.content: Qaboos was the Middle Easts longest-ruling monarch, seizing power in a 1970 palace coup. He was known internationally for his diplomatic balancing in the volatile Persian Gulf. The ruler often served as a facilitator of talks between adversaries Iran and the … [+1958 chars]

articles.author: Kim Tong-Hyung | AP
articles.title: N Korea: Trump's birthday greet not enough to resume talks
articles.description: A North Korean official says the U.S. and South Korea are dreaming if they think that President Donald Trump's sending a birthday message would get leader Kim Jong Un back to the negotiating table
articles.content: He was responding to comments by South Korean presidential national security director Chung Eui-yong who, after returning from a visit to the United States on Friday, said that Seoul had conveyed Trumps birthday greetings to Kim. His birthday is believed to b… [+3088 chars]
